column1: Table D3.10.5: Residential mental health care episodes, by Indigenous status(a) and jurisdiction(b), 2017â€“18

(a) These data should be interpreted with caution due to the varying quality of Indigenous identification across jurisdictions, see <https://www.aihw.gov.au/reports/mental-health-services/mental-health-services-in-australia/report-contents/state-and-territory-community-mental-health-care-services/data-source>.
(b) Data are reported by the jurisdiction that delivered the service.

(c) NSW has a different model of care. See <https://www.aihw.gov.au/reports/mental-health-services/mental-health-services-in-australia/report-contents/specialised-mental-health-care-facilities/specialised-mental-health-beds-and-patient-days>.
(d) Rates have been directly age-standardised using the Australian 2001 standard population.
(e) Number per 10,000 population based on estimated resident population as at 30 June 2017.
(f) Rate ratio is the age-standardised rate for Indigenous Australians divided by the age-standardised rate for non-Indigenous Australians.
(g) Rate difference is the age-standardised rate for Indigenous Australians minus the age-standardised rate for non-Indigenous Australians.
Source: AIHW analysis of National Residential Mental Health Care Database.
